Yes, Shepherds!  swell the strain, and weave the dance</br>In cheerful circles down your echoing vales—</br>Then, bounding like the Alpine deer, advance</br>With streamers gaily deck'd with pictur'd tales;</br>Ye maidens, poising well your rich hung pails,</br>Mothers, with infants smiling like the morn,</br>All, all advance — an airy herald sails</br>With the swift tidings that a Prince is born—</br>Shout the last shout of joy, and to your shades return.

Yes, shout! — that peal of gladness is your last!</br>Wave high your trophies, and your off'rings spread!</br>Now be ye dumb!  and on the ocean cast</br>Your heart's oblation — for your Prince is dead!</br>Dead e'er he lived!  for by his mother's bed,</br>Mocking the nurse's care, the leech's skill,</br>Stood iron-hearted fate, and scowling fled</br>With his scarce kindled spirit — "Just heaven, thy will,"</br>The lovely mother sigh'd, "be done!  poor heart, lie still."</br>
